faq.question: What is an accordion UI component?
faq.answer: An accordion is a vertically stacked list of items that can expand to reveal additional content or collapse to hide it.

faq.question: When should I use an accordion?
faq.answer: Accordions are best used for FAQs, settings panels, or situations where you want to organize content into expandable sections.

faq.question: How does an accordion improve user experience?
faq.answer: It helps reduce clutter by only showing the most relevant information and allowing users to expand sections when they need more details.

faq.question: Can I style my accordion?
faq.answer: Yes, you can customize the styles using CSS or a UI framework to match your application's look and feel.

faq.question: Is an accordion mobile-friendly?
faq.answer: Yes, accordions are commonly used on mobile devices because they save space and keep content organized.
